title: Why can't my phone be discovered by other Bluetooth devices?
answer:
Bluetooth has been turned off on your phone. 

 Solution 1: Go to Settings and turn on Bluetooth. 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=109353)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=109354)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=109355)

 Solution 2: Turn on Bluetooth from the notification panel. 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=109356)![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=109357)

 Bluetooth is turned on, but your phone is not set to be visible to other devices. 

 Solution: Go to Settings and touch Bluetooth > Visibility. 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=109358)

 The Bluetooth detection has timed out. 

 Solution 1: Touch Settings > Bluetooth, turn off Visibility and turn it back on to recount the detection time. (Refer to the preceding figure.) 

 [Touch ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=109359) > Visibility timeout and set a longer timeout period.]()
